intro: Tylecarpus papuanus, commonly known as the Papuan tylecarpus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Papua and surrounding areas. It belongs to the family Araliaceae, which includes a variety of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or greenish in color. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along stream banks. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
